title: Is this player bad or just feeding?
body: This guy appeared in my ranked game and he was so unbelievably bad I had to check his previous match records and this is what I find. is this the correct place to bring this or is there anywhere. I can get an admin's attention or something. This guy is just ruining games for so many people nonstop.

replies.body:
1. this is name shaming.
2. We won't know without actually watching the games
3. send a ticket into support if you really need to know.
4. Ryze isn't for everyone xD
He didn't just play ryze he has other champions with the same record
If you want to show it to riot send a support ticket to them. Include the summoner's name and any photos that you have.

Can't really tell without more information/actually being able to watch the games to see how he's playing. Also, what rank is he?

Also, clearly the most disturbing part of this isn't the number of times he's dying, it's those CS numbers. 15 cs with Ryze? Sad.

Even if he was bronze 5. He has to have reached level 30. At level 30 you should know to cs. it was 18 mins in the game at the moment we lost and he only had 15 cs. 15 cs in 18 mins. That's not even 1 cs a minute.

You _should_ know to farm, but not everyone does. It sounds impossible, but some people actually are that bad. They are the worst of the worst, never bothered to learn the basics of the game, never had anyone teach them, and never looked up how to play. But they do exist.
feeding and nothing will be done cuz riot sucks

I found the game in your match history.  He is just bad.  If he was feeding, 6 out of  of his deaths wouldn't have been under his own tower and he wouldn't have done the second most damage on your team.

Like others have said its really hard to tell with just the scores. Actual gameplay footage would help as that would determine if he was trolling or not. But right off the bat nothing seems out of the ordinary. His build seems normal, and his only "troll" like behavior is dying too many times. But with a champion like Ryze that has a large learning curve its not to hard to believe he just playing badly. He is probably new to the game/champion, or saw someone he likes (streamer, or proplayer) playing with this champion and decided to try him out.
He was just auto attacking top no skills or csing were done.
I can't believe he was just new to the game excuse cause he reached level 30. How many games do you need to get to level 30

I think this player deserves a ban ! Look at it ! He has JUST ONE LEVEL mastery on a Ryze ! We all know that the new Ryze requires some skills. This guy should get more knowledge of the game and OF COURSE practice Ryze in normals if he really likes the champion. But trying it in ranked games should be punishable. (That's my opinion)

Ryze is a champion that has a steep learning curve, and you're punished heavily for the slightest slipup. More importantly, higher latency (200+ms) connections basically turn Ryze into an instakill for any bursty enemy, while low (~20ms) latency connections allow Ryze to delete you, if you're good at him.

Some people struggle with Ryze, I did when I first joined and it made me nervous to try him, still haven't to this day.

I think it's important to look at his rank vs the rank the match was in. If he's a newer player to ranked, some of those could be in Qualifiers, which often place you in a higher ranked environment (I got put into S1/G5 Elo for my first 2 matches, then S3-4 for my next 3)
These scores look like mine sometimes. Probably just bad.
You would have to watch the games to really know.
